Modus Ponens

DM
Jun 4, 2021

Also known as Law of Detachment.

Lemma

DM
Jun 4, 2021

Less important Theorem that could be helpful in Proofs of other results.

Informal Proofs

DM
Jun 4, 2021

Can have more than one rule of inference in steps, steps can be skipped and axioms can not be stated explicitly.

Indirect Proofs

DM
Jun 4, 2021

Hypothetical syllogism

DM
Jun 4, 2021

$$((p \to q) \wedge (q \to r) \to (p \to r))$$

Forward Reasoning

DM
Jun 4, 2021

You start with the Premises, then by using Axioms and known Theorem by a series of steps you reach Conclusion.

Fermat's Last Theorem

DM
Jun 4, 2021

The equation $x^n + y^n = z^n$ has no solution when $xyz \neq 0$ when $n >2$.

Fallacy of denying the hypothesis

DM
Jun 4, 2021

Proposition $((p \to q) \wedge \neg p) \to \not q$ is not a tautology (when p=False and q=True). But many incorrect arguments treat it like a tautology. This is Fallacy of denying the hypothesis.

Fallacy of affirming the conclusion

DM
Jun 4, 2021

Proposition $((p \to q) \wedge q) \to p$ is not a tautology (when p=False and q=True). But many incorrect arguments treat it like a tautology. This is Fallacy of affirming the conclusion.

Jun 4, 2021

It is incorrect form of reasoning.
